Quotations.ab: (18.1) gōwēd pad dēn kū panǰ ēwēnag ātaxš brēhēnīd estēd čiyōn (18.2) ātaxš ī burzisawang ātaxš ī pēš ī ohrmazd ī xwadāy waxšēd (18.3) ātaxš ī vohufriyān ān ī andar tan ī mardōmān ud gōspandān (18.4) ātaxš ī urwāzišt ān ī andar urwarān (18.5) ātaxš ī wāzišt ān ī andar abr padīrag ī spinǰaγr pad kōxšišn estēd (18.6) ud ātaxš ī spēništ ān ī pad gēhān pad kār dāšt estēd ud ātaxšiz warahrān.

"(18.1) It is said at the compilation of the religion (Dēn) that five types of fire were created this way: (18.2) the fire (called) Burzisawang, that burns in front of the lord Ohrmazd; (18.3) the fire (called) Vohufriyān, that is inside of the bodies of men and cattle; (18.4) the fire (called) Urwāzišt, that it is inside the plants; (18.5) the fire (called) Wāzišt, that is inside a cloud in struggle opposed to Spinǰaγr; (18.6) and the fire (called) Spēništ, that it is in use in the material world and also (called) fire Warahrān."
